metadata.title: USN-7067-1 -- HAProxy vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that HAProxy did not properly limit the creation of new HTTP/2 streams. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause HAProxy to consume excessive resources, leading to a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7067-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3 haproxy-doc - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3 vim-haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
